page.title: 16FARMING IN GRIMLEY
page.content: There are twelve farms in Grimley. The farms with most land are Church Farm and Noken Farm. The latter is a dairy farm with about a hundred milk- ing cows and a hundred heifers and calves. Church Farm has a sizeable ar- ea of land under crops. Moorcroft Farm has a herd of 30 cattle for beef. Mr. Knight, the farmer, buys and sells his stock at Hereford and Kidderminster markets. The breeds he keeps are Simmenthal x Friesian and pure Simmen- thal. He has only one part-time farm- worker. Sinton Farm is a small dairy farm with 22 cows. Oakhall Farm is a- gain small with 20 cows and 40 sheep. Some market gardening is carried on. Most farms have stock and much land is rough pasture or left to grow to be cut for hay and silage. Generally the farms are small and are a family con- cern with little outside help.
